1035491879364775936.text: Social innovation is hard to sell as it's invisible and not as shiny as e.g. autonomous vehicles. However, people do understand the value of democracies. With time the general audience will see the point of decentralized tech as well.

1035491877297037312.text: Blockchains are not as efficient as centralized systems. Instead blockchains like democracies achieve social innovation: self-sovereign data ownership, privacy, trust minimization, code interoperability by default, censorship-resistance.

1035491875468271616.text: Evaluating blockchains by tech specs (scalabilty, tx/s) is like evaluating political systems by decision speed. Democracies loose by this metric. They achieve something different instead: civil rights, freedom, no single point of failure (e.g. dictator)

1027524748203442176.text:
"Something similar to Apple's Keychain with a client-side encryption supported by the browser would prevent this." 

We need this! This is essential for dapps to be able to store local data securely.
